description: Gets information about a specific work team. You can see information such as the creation date, the last updated date, membership information, and the work team's Amazon Resource Name (ARN).

parameters.name: WorkteamName
parameters.description: The name of the work team to return a description of.

nested_items.name: WorkteamName
nested_items.description: The name of the work team.

nested_items.name: MemberDefinitions
nested_items.description: A list of MemberDefinition objects that contains objects that identify the workers that make up the work team.

nested_items.name: CognitoMemberDefinition
nested_items.description: The Amazon Cognito user group that is part of the work team.

nested_items.name: UserPool
nested_items.description: An identifier for a user pool. The user pool must be in the same region as the service that you are calling.

nested_items.name: UserGroup
nested_items.description: An identifier for a user group.

nested_items.name: ClientId
nested_items.description: An identifier for an application client. You must create the app client ID using Amazon Cognito.

nested_items.name: OidcMemberDefinition
nested_items.description: A list user groups that exist in your OIDC Identity Provider (IdP). One to ten groups can be used to create a single private work team. When you add a user group to the list of Groups, you can add that user group to one or more private work teams. If you add a user group to a private work team, all workers in that user group are added to the work team.

nested_items.name: Groups
nested_items.description: A list of comma seperated strings that identifies user groups in your OIDC IdP. Each user group is made up of a group of private workers.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: WorkteamArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that identifies the work team.

nested_items.name: WorkforceArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the workforce.

nested_items.name: ProductListingIds
nested_items.description: The Amazon Marketplace identifier for a vendor's work team.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: A description of the work team.

nested_items.name: SubDomain
nested_items.description: The URI of the labeling job's user interface. Workers open this URI to start labeling your data objects.

nested_items.name: CreateDate
nested_items.description: The date and time that the work team was created (timestamp).

nested_items.name: LastUpdatedDate
nested_items.description: The date and time that the work team was last updated (timestamp).

nested_items.name: NotificationConfiguration
nested_items.description: Configures SNS notifications of available or expiring work items for work teams.

nested_items.name: NotificationTopicArn
nested_items.description: The ARN for the Amazon SNS topic to which notifications should be published.

nested_items.name: WorkerAccessConfiguration
nested_items.description: Describes any access constraints that have been defined for Amazon S3 resources.

nested_items.name: S3Presign
nested_items.description: Defines any Amazon S3 resource constraints.

nested_items.name: IamPolicyConstraints
nested_items.description: Use this parameter to specify the allowed request source. Possible sources are either SourceIp or VpcSourceIp.

nested_items.name: SourceIp
nested_items.description: When SourceIp is Enabled the worker's IP address when a task is rendered in the worker portal is added to the IAM policy as a Condition used to generate the Amazon S3 presigned URL. This IP address is checked by Amazon S3 and must match in order for the Amazon S3 resource to be rendered in the worker portal.

nested_items.name: VpcSourceIp
nested_items.description: When VpcSourceIp is Enabled the worker's IP address when a task is rendered in private worker portal inside the VPC is added to the IAM policy as a Condition used to generate the Amazon S3 presigned URL. To render the task successfully Amazon S3 checks that the presigned URL is being accessed over an Amazon S3 VPC Endpoint, and that the worker's IP address matches the IP address in the IAM policy. To learn more about configuring private worker portal, see Use Amazon VPC mode from a private worker portal.
